intro: Tournefortia jamaicensis, commonly known as Jamaican tournefortia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Jamaica. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal areas or disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated for its attractive foliage and floral display.
